intro: Pocilla agrestis, commonly known as the field pocilla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its slender stems are often branched, and it produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are usually pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
